content.description: A fun one-move wonder to the right of Baby Fat, Jelly Belly is basically a single 10a roof sequence up a finger/hand crack followed by some easy laybacking, but it's a fun move and there isn't that much to climb at Indian Rock, so you might as well give it a whirl.
content.protection: Two bolts: one before the roof and one above. Bolted anchor. Would be easy to TR.
content.location: To the right of Baby Fat, scramble up right and start at the bolt to the left of the crack. That crack is your crack. The bolt actually belongs to a 5.11b route that heads up left of the crack.

content.description: The only bolted climb on The Globule that faces Indian Rock.  The roof is very odd and requires a little resourcefulness, but is still no harder than an .11a once you figure out what you're doing.The rest of the climb takes advantage of the large heucos up the face above.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.Stick clip the first bolt, as the crux is getting to the bolt, clipping it and pulling the roof at the first bolt.There is also ground fall potential at the second bolt, but the climbing is pretty easy to it compared to below.
